00047 WINDOW *start_window = NULL;   /* Start window of double linked list */

00062 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00063     FUNCTION: wn_closeall()
00064      PURPOSE: Close all opened windows.
00065       SYNTAX: void wn_closeall(void);
00066  DESCRIPTION: Goes through the linked window list and closes all windows
00067               in this list.
00068      RETURNS: Always returns TRUE
00069      HISTORY: 920224 V0.1
00070 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00071 int wn_closeall()
00072 {
00073   WINDOW *w, *nextw;
00074 
00075   /*------------------
00076     Close all windows
00077   --------------------*/
00078   if (start_window != NULL) {
00079     w = start_window;
00080     while (w) {
00081       nextw = w->next;
00082       wn_close(w);
00083       w = nextw;
00084     }
00085   }
00086   return(TRUE);
00087 }
00088 
00089 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00090     FUNCTION: wn_update()
00091      PURPOSE: window update
00092       SYNTAX: int wn_update(void);
00093  DESCRIPTION: Update entire screen by redrawing all window's from the window
00094               list in the order as they are in this list on a virtual screen,
00095               after which this virtual screen will be copied to the physical
00096               screen.
00097      RETURNS: TRUE if all OK, FALSE if not
00098      HISTORY: 920212 V0.1
00099               920919 V0.2 Now also fills virtual window with _desktop_att
00100               920920 V0.3 Hidden windows will not be drawn.
00101 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00102 int wn_update()
00103 {
00104   WINDOW *w;
00105 
00106   wn_log("wn_update() START **** \n");
00107   wn_log_indent(+2);
00108 
00109   /*-------------------------------
00110     Save window currently active
00111   -------------------------------*/
00112   if (top_window)
00113     wn_save(top_window);
00114 
00115   /*---------------------------------------------
00116     Fill virtual screen with desktop attribute if
00117     no desktop saved
00118   ---------------------------------------------*/
00119   /*
00120   if (!wn_desktop(1))
00121     v_fillarea(0,0,_cursvar.cols,_cursvar.lines,' ',_desktop_att);
00122   */
00123   clrscr();
00124 
00125   /*------------------------------------
00126     Draw all windows on virtual screen
00127   -------------------------------------*/
00128   if (start_window != NULL) {
00129     w = start_window;
00130     while (w) {
00131       if (! (w->flag & HIDDEN))     /* Restore window if not hidden */
00132         wn_restore(w);
00133       w = w->next;
00134     }
00135   }
00136 
00137   wn_log_indent(-2);
00138   wn_log("wn_update() END ****\n");
00139 
00140   /*---------------------
00141     Return all OK flag
00142   ----------------------*/
00143   return(TRUE);
00144 }

00147 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00148    FUNCTION: wn_dmode()
00149     PURPOSE: Set window display mode (PAINT or FLASH)
00150 DESCRIPTION: This a dummy for compatibility with WindowBoss
00151     RETURNS: nothing
00152     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
00153 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00154 void wn_dmode(int mode)
00155 {
00156   mode++;
00157 }
00158 
00159 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00160    FUNCTION: wn_save()
00161     PURPOSE: Save a window, including the border (if any)
00162      SYNTAX: WINDOW *wn_save(WINDOWPTR w);
00163 DESCRIPTION: If no space was allocated, this function will allocate
00164              memory to save the window. If space was allocated, we
00165              assume that the size of the window has not been changed.
00166     RETURNS: nothing
00167     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
00168              920106 V0.2 - Now also saves the border (if any)
00169              920916 V0.3 - Now also saves the area for the shadow effect
00170              931011 V0.4 - Now call v_gettext (origin 0,0)
00171 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00172 WINDOW *wn_save(WINDOWPTR w)
00173 {
00174   int row,col;
00175 
00176   if (!w)              /* Check if window opened */
00177     return(NULL);
00178   wn_log("wn_save(%p,%s) (%d,%d)-(%d,%d) \n",w,w->title,w->wx1,w->wy1,w->wx2,w->wy2);
00179 
00180   /*---------------------------------------
00181     Allocate memory for saving window
00182     (inclusive border and shadow)
00183   ---------------------------------------*/
00184   if (!w->scrnsave) {
00185     w->scrnsave = (char *) calloc((w->xsize)*(w->ysize)*2,1);
00186     if (!w->scrnsave) {
00187       fprintf(stderr,"Not enough memory to save window\n");
00188       exit(1);
00189     }
00190   }
00191 
00192   /*---------------------------------------
00193     Save contents of the window
00194   ---------------------------------------*/
00195   v_gettext(w->wx1,w->wy1,w->wx2,w->wy2,w->scrnsave);
00196 
00197   /*-------------------------------
00198     Save cursor info of the window
00199   ---------------------------------*/
00200   v_getcurpos(&row,&col);
00201   w->ccy = row;
00202   w->ccx = col;
00203 
00204   return(w);        /* Return pointer to last saved window */
00205 
00206 }
00207 
00208 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00209    FUNCTION: wn_hide()
00210     PURPOSE: Hide a window
00211      SYNTAX: int wn_hide(WINDOWPTR w);
00212 DESCRIPTION: Hide a window by settting the window flag to HIDDEN and
00213              update the complete screen. Hidden windows will not be drawn
00214     RETURNS: NO_WINDOW if window 'w' not opened.
00215              TRUE if all OK.
00216     HISTORY: 920130 V0.1 - Initial version
00217 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00218 int wn_hide(WINDOWPTR w)
00219 {
00220   wn_log("wn_hide(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
00221 
00222   if (!w)                   /* Check if window opened */
00223     return(NO_WINDOW);
00224   w->flag = TRUE;           /* Set hidden flag        */
00225   wn_update();              /* Update all windows     */
00226   return(TRUE);
00227 }
00228 
00229 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00230    FUNCTION: wn_unhide()
00231     PURPOSE: Unhide a window
00232      SYNTAX: int wn_unhide(WINDOWPTR w);
00233 DESCRIPTION: Unhide a window by resettting the hideflag
00234              update the complete screen.
00235     RETURNS: NO_WINDOW if window 'w' not opened.
00236              TRUE if all OK.
00237     HISTORY: 920130 V0.1 - Initial version
00238              931021 V0.2 - Now uses w->hideflag (was w->flag)
00239 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00240 int wn_unhide(WINDOWPTR w)
00241 {
00242   wn_log("wn_unhide(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
00243 
00244   if (!w)                       /* Check if window opened */
00245     return(NO_WINDOW);
00246   w->hideflag = 0;              /* Reset hidden flag */
00247   wn_update();                  /* Update all windows */
00248   return(TRUE);
00249 }
00250 
00251 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00252     FUNCTION: wn_move()
00253      PURPOSE: Move a window on the screen
00254       SYNTAX: int wn_move(WINDOW *w , int row, int col);
00255  DESCRIPTION: Move window 'w' to 'row' and 'col'
00256      RETURNS: NO_WINDOW if window 'w' not opened.
00257               TRUE if all OK.
00258      HISTORY: 920920 V0.1 - Initial version
00259 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00260 int wn_move(WINDOW *w , int row, int col)
00261 {
00262   int dx = 0;
00263   int dy = 0;
00264 
00265   wn_log("wn_move(%p,%s,%2d,%2d)\n",w,w->title,row,col);
00266   wn_log_indent(+2);
00267 
00268   /*--------------------------
00269     Check if window opened
00270   --------------------------*/
00271   if (!w)
00272     return(NO_WINDOW);
00273 
00274   /*--------------------------
00275     Check parameters
00276   --------------------------*/
00277   row = minmax(0,row,_cursvar.lines);
00278   col = minmax(0,col,_cursvar.cols);
00279 
00280   /*----------------------------------------------
00281     Calculate in which direction we have to move
00282   -----------------------------------------------*/
00283   if (row > w->wy1) dy=1; else dy=-1 ;
00284   if (col > w->wx1) dx=1; else dx=-1 ;
00285 
00286   /*---------------------------------
00287     Move the window over the screen
00288   -----------------------------------*/
00289   do {
00290     /* Update column pointers */
00291     if (((dx>0 && w->wx2<_cursvar.cols) || (dx<0 && w->wx1 > 0)) && w->wx1 != col) {
00292       w->wx1 += dx;
00293       w->wx2 += dx;
00294       w->x1  += dx;
00295       w->x2  += dx;
00296     }
00297     /* Update row pointers */
00298     if (((dy>0 && w->wy2 < _cursvar.lines) || (dy<0 && w->wy1 > 0)) && w->wy1 != row) {
00299       w->wy1 += dy;
00300       w->wy2 += dy;
00301       w->y1  += dy;
00302       w->y2  += dy;
00303     }
00304     wn_restore(w);
00305     wn_update();
00306     wn_log("target row=%2d, target col=%2d\n",row,col);
00307     wn_log("moved to (%02d,%02d)\n",w->wx1, w->wy1);
00308   }
00309   while ((w->wx1 != col) || (w->wy1 != row));
00310 
00311   wn_log_indent(-2);
00312   wn_log("end of wn_move()\n");
00313 
00314   return(0);
00315 
00316 }
00317 
00318 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00319    FUNCTION: wn_restore()
00320     PURPOSE: Restore window border, contents and cursor on the screen.
00321      SYNTAX: void wn_restore(WINDOWPTR w);
00322 DESCRIPTION: -
00323     RETURNS: nothing
00324     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
00325 
00326 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00327 void wn_restore(WINDOWPTR w)
00328 {
00329 
00330   wn_log("wn_restore(%p,%s) (%d,%d)-(%d,%d)\n",w,w->title,w->wx1,w->wy1,w->wx2,w->wy2);
00331 
00332   if (!w)             /* Check if window opened */
00333     return;
00334   if (w->hideflag)    /* Check if window not hidden */
00335     return;
00336 
00337   if (w->scrnsave)    /* Restore contents of window */
00338     v_puttext(w->wx1,w->wy1,w->wx2,w->wy2,w->scrnsave);
00339 
00340   wn_fixcsr(w);     /* Initialize cursor */
00341 
00342 }
00343 
00344 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00345    FUNCTION: wn_top()
00346     PURPOSE: Make a window the top window
00347      SYNTAX: int wn_top(WINDOW *w);
00348 DESCRIPTION: Make window 'w' the top window by:
00349              Transfering it to the end of the list of windows
00350              Saving the contents of the current top window
00351              Restoring the contents of window 'w'
00352     RETURNS: NO_WINDOW: window not opened
00353              TRUE     : all ok
00354     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1
00355 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00356 int wn_top(WINDOW *w)
00357 {
00358   if (!w)                    /* Check if the window is opened */
00359     return(NO_WINDOW);
00360   wn_log("wn_top(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
00361 
00362   if (w != last_window) {    /* If the window is not the last window */
00363     del_wn_list(w);          /* Of the double linked list, put it in */
00364     add_wn_list(w);          /* the last position */
00365   }
00366 
00367   if (w == top_window)       /* Check if window not already top window */
00368     wn_fixcsr(w);
00369   else
00370   {
00371     if (top_window != NULL)
00372       wn_save(top_window);   /* Save contents of active window */
00373     top_window = w;          /* Set pointer to top window */
00374     wn_restore(w);           /* Restore contents of new active window */
00375   }
00376 
00377   return(TRUE);
00378 }
00379 
00380

00384      SYNTAX: void wn_dma(int flag);

00386     RETURNS: nothing
00387     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Intitial version
00388 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00389 void wn_dma(int flag)
00390 {
00391   flag++;
00392 }

00394 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00395    FUNCTION: wn_sync()
00396     PURPOSE: set/clear window's cursor synchronisation flag
00397      SYNTAX: wn_sync(WINDOW *w, int flag);
00398 DESCRIPTION: If flag is TRUE, subsequent text output will be
00399              followed by a flashing (normal) cursor. If FALSE
00400              the cursor will not be physically advanced
00401     RETURNS: A copy of the flag
00402     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
00403 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00404 int wn_sync(WINDOW *w, int flag)
00405 {
00406   /*------------------------
00407     Check if window opened
00408   --------------------------*/
00409   if (!w)
00410     return(NO_WINDOW);
00411 
00412   w->synflg = flag;
00413   return(flag);
00414 }
00415 
00416 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00417    FUNCTION: wn_fixcsr()
00418     PURPOSE: Update window's cursor position
00419      SYNTAX: int wn_fixcsr(WINDOW *w);
00420 DESCRIPTION: Place the physical cursor at the logical window cursor
00421              position. Does not alter the state of window's syncflag.
00422              Is mostly used after a wn_sync() to disable the cursor.
00423     RETURNS: TRUE, or FALSE if error
00424     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
00425 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00426 int wn_fixcsr(WINDOW *w)
00427 {
00428   /*------------------------
00429     Check if window opened
00430   --------------------------*/
00431   if (!w)
00432     return(NO_WINDOW);
00433 
00434   /*--------------------------------
00435     Check if this is the top window
00436   ----------------------------------*/
00437   if (w != top_window)
00438     return(NO_WINDOW);
00439 
00440   /*--------------------------------------
00441     Get physical cursor coordinates and
00442     show cursor (if wanted
00443   --------------------------------------*/
00444   v_setcurpos(w->ccy,w->ccx);
00445   if (w->synflg)
00446     v_cursoron();
00447   else
00448     v_cursoroff();
00449 
00450   return(TRUE);
00451 }
00452 
00453 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00454     FUNCTION: wn_fill()
00455      PURPOSE: Fill part of a opened window with character and attribute
00456       SYNTAX: void wn_fill(WINDOW *w, int row, int col, int width, int height,
00457               int c, int att);
00458  DESCRIPTION:
00459      RETURNS: Nothing
00460      HISTORY: 14-Oct-1993 V0.1
00461 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00462 void wn_fill(WINDOW *w, int row, int col, int width, int height, int c, int att)
00463 {
00464   v_fillarea(w->y1+row,w->x1+col,width,height,c,att);
00465 }

00468     FUNCTION: wn_setattrib()
00469      PURPOSE: Set attribute of a field within a window
00470       SYNTAX: void wn_setattrib(WINDOW *w, int row1, int col1, int xsize,int ysize, int att);
00471  DESCRIPTION: -

00475 void wn_setattrib(WINDOW *w, int row1, int col1, int xsize,int ysize, int att)
00476 {
00477   v_setattrib_area(w->y1+row1, w->x1+col1, xsize, ysize, att);
00478 }

00480 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00481     FUNCTION: wn_setone()
00482      PURPOSE: Set attribute of 1 character in a window
00483       SYNTAX: int wn_setone(WINDOW *w, int row, int col, int attrib);
00484               WINDOW *w : pointer to window to perform action on
00485               int row   : row (y) of position to set
00486               int col   : col (x) of position to set
00487               int attrib: attribute to set on (row,col) in window 'w'
00488  DESCRIPTION: -
00489      RETURNS: 0         if all OK
00490               NO_WINDOW if window not opened
00491      HISTORY: 920926 V0.1
00492 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00493 int wn_setone(WINDOW *w, int row, int col, int attrib)
00494 {
00495   /*----------------------------------
00496     Check if window opened and topped
00497   -----------------------------------*/
00498   if (!w)
00499     return(NO_WINDOW);
00500 
00501   /*---------------------------
00502     Call the routine setone()
00503   ----------------------------*/
00504   v_setattrib(w->y1+row,w->x1+col,attrib);
00505   return(0);
00506 }

00509 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00510    FUNCTION: wn_nattrib()
00511     PURPOSE: Set and change window attribute
00512      SYNTAX: int wn_nattrib(WINDOW *w, int wattrib);
00513 DESCRIPTION: The attribute of window 'w'is changed immediately.
00514              The border will not be altered.
00515     RETURNS: NO_WINDOW if no window opened.
00516              TRUE if all ok.
00517     HISTORY: 910907 V0.1 - Initial version
00518 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00519 int wn_nattrib(WINDOW *w, int wcolor)
00520 {
00521   /*----------------------------------
00522     Check if window opened and topped
00523   -----------------------------------*/
00524   if (!w)
00525     return(NO_WINDOW);
00526   if (w != top_window)
00527     wn_top(w);
00528 
00529   w->wcolor = wcolor;     /* Save attribute */
00530   v_setattrib_area(w->y1, w->x1, w->xsize, w->ysize, wcolor);
00531   return(TRUE);
00532 }
00533 
00534 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00535     FUNCTION: add_wn_list()
00536      PURPOSE: Add window to double linked list
00537       SYNTAX: WINDOw *add_wn_list(WINDOW *w);
00538  DESCRIPTION: -
00539      RETURNS: pointer to window at start of list
00540      HISTORY: 910730 V0.1 - Initial version
00541 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00542 static WINDOW *add_wn_list(WINDOW *w)
00543 {
00544   WINDOW *tmp_w;
00545 
00546   wn_log("add_wn_list(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
00547 
00548   /*-----------------------
00549     Check if window opened
00550   -------------------------*/
00551   if (!w)
00552     return(NULL);
00553 
00554   /*-----------------------------------
00555     Add window to double linked list
00556   ------------------------------------*/
00557   if (start_window == NULL)
00558   {
00559     /*--- This is the first window in the list ---*/
00560     last_window  = w;
00561     start_window = w;
00562     w->next   = NULL;
00563     w->prev   = NULL;
00564   }
00565   else
00566   {
00567     /*--- Add this window to end of the list ---*/
00568     last_window->next = w;
00569     w->next  = NULL;
00570     w->prev  = last_window;
00571     last_window = w;
00572   }
00573 
00574   tmp_w = start_window;
00575   while(tmp_w)
00576     tmp_w = tmp_w->next;
00577 
00578   return(start_window);
00579 }
00580 
00581 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00582     FUNCTION: del_wn_list()
00583      PURPOSE: delete window control block from double linked list
00584       SYNTAX: WINDOW *del_wn_list(WINDOW *w);
00585  DESCRIPTION: -
00586      RETURNS: pointer to start of list
00587      HISTORY: 910730 V0.1 - Initial version
00588 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00589 static WINDOW *del_wn_list(WINDOW *w)
00590 {
00591   wn_log("del_wn_list(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
00592 
00593   /*------------------------
00594     Check if window opened
00595   --------------------------*/
00596   if (!w)
00597     return(NULL);
00598 
00599   if (w == start_window)
00600   {
00601     /*--- We are going to delete the first window in the
00602           double linked list ---*/
00603     start_window = start_window->next;
00604     if (start_window)
00605       start_window->prev = NULL;
00606     if (!start_window)   /* If no window opened any more ... */
00607       last_window = NULL;
00608   }
00609   else {
00610     /*--- We are going to delete a window in the middle or at the
00611           end of the double linked list ---*/
00612     if (!w->next) {
00613       /*--- This window is the last one of the list ---*/
00614       last_window = w->prev;
00615       w->prev->next = NULL;
00616     }
00617     else {
00618       /*--- This window is in the middle of the list ---*/
00619       w->prev->next = w->next;
00620       w->next->prev = w->prev;
00621     }
00622   }
00623 
00624   level_wnds(start_window);
00625   return(start_window);
00626 }
00627 
00628 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00629     FUNCTION: level_windows()
00630      PURPOSE: This funtion runs thru the list from the beginning and
00631               reassignes level values to each window after and inser-
00632               tion or deletion.
00633       SYNTAX: static void level_wnds(WINDOW *startw);
00634  DESCRIPTION:
00635      RETURNS: nothing
00636      HISTORY: 21-Oct-1993 V0.1
00637 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00638 static void level_wnds(WINDOW *startw)
00639 {
00640   int  i = 1;
00641   WINDOW *w;
00642 
00643   w = startw;
00644   while (w) {               /* While window pointer not NULL */
00645     w->level = i++;         /* Assign a new level number */
00646     wn_log("  --- %p (%s) level:%2d\n",w,w->title,w->level);
00647     w = w->next;            /* Get next window */
00648   }
00649 }
00650 
00651 
00652 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00653    FUNCTION: wn_open()
00654     PURPOSE: open and use a new text window. Origin is (0,0)
00655      SYNTAX: WINDOW *wn_open(int btype, int row, int col, int xsize,
00656                              int ysize, int wcolor, int bcolor);
00657 DESCRIPTION: btype   = border type (_NO_BORDER,_SINGLE_LINE,_DOUBLE_LINE).
00658              row     = top left row of window
00659              col     = top left column of window
00660              xsize   = width of contents of window  (inclusive border)
00661              ysize   = height of contents of window (inclusive border)
00662              wcolor  = color of window contents
00663              bcolor  = color of border
00664     RETURNS: Pointer to the window control block of opened window
00665     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
00666 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00667 WINDOW *wn_open( int btype,         /* Window type      */
00668                  int row,           /* Top left row     */
00669                  int col,           /* Top left corner  */
00670                  int xsize,         /* External width   */
00671                  int ysize,         /* External height  */
00672                  int wcolor,        /* Window attribute */
00673                  int bcolor)        /* Border attribute */
00674 {
00675   WINDOWPTR w;
00676 
00677   /*----------------------------------
00678     Reserve memory for the window
00679   -----------------------------------*/
00680   w = (WINDOWPTR) calloc(sizeof(WINDOW),1);
00681   if (!w) {
00682     fprintf(stderr,"Not enough memory to open window\n");
00683     exit(1);
00684   }
00685 
00686   wn_log("wn_open() %p: (%2d,%2d) w=%2d h=%2d\n",w,row,col,xsize,ysize);
00687 
00688   /*------------------
00689     Check parameters
00690   -------------------*/
00691   if (btype == _NO_BORDER) {
00692     wn_log("wn_open(1) NO_BORDER\n");
00693     /*---------------------------------------
00694       Window has no border
00695     ---------------------------------------*/
00696     ysize  = minmax(0,ysize,_cursvar.lines);
00697     xsize  = minmax(0,xsize,_cursvar.cols);
00698         wn_log("wn_open(2) xsize = %d   ysize = %d\n",xsize,ysize);
00699 
00700     row = minmax(0,row,_cursvar.lines);
00701     col = minmax(0,col,_cursvar.cols);
00702         wn_log("wn_open(3) row = %d   col = %d\n",row,col);
00703 
00704     if (row+ysize > _cursvar.lines)
00705       ysize = _cursvar.lines-row;
00706     if (col+xsize > _cursvar.cols)
00707       xsize = _cursvar.cols-col;
00708         wn_log("wn_open(4) xsize = %d   ysize = %d\n",xsize,ysize);
00709   }
00710   else {
00711 
00712     wn_log("wn_open() WITH BORDER");
00713     /*---------------------------------------
00714       Window has a border
00715     ---------------------------------------*/
00716     ysize  = minmax(0,ysize,_cursvar.lines);
00717     xsize  = minmax(0,xsize,_cursvar.cols);
00718         wn_log("wn_open() xsize = %d   ysize = %d\n",xsize,ysize);
00719 
00720     row = minmax(0,row,_cursvar.lines-4);
00721     col = minmax(0,col,_cursvar.cols-4);
00722         wn_log("wn_open() row = %d   col = %d\n",row,col);
00723 
00724     if (row+ysize > _cursvar.lines-2)
00725       ysize  = (_cursvar.lines-row);
00726     if (col+xsize > _cursvar.cols-2)
00727       xsize = _cursvar.cols-col;
00728         wn_log("wn_open() xsize = %d   ysize = %d\n",xsize,ysize);
00729   }
00730 
00731   /*---------------------------------------
00732     Save coordinates of complete window
00733   ---------------------------------------*/
00734   w->wx1 = col;
00735   w->wy1 = row;
00736   w->wx2 = w->wx1 + xsize - 1;
00737   w->wy2 = w->wy1 + ysize - 1;
00738 
00739   /*---------------------------------------
00740     Save coordinates of 'text' window
00741   ---------------------------------------*/
00742   if (btype == _NO_BORDER) {
00743     w->x1 = w->wx1;
00744     w->y1 = w->wy1;
00745     w->x2 = w->wx2;
00746     w->y2 = w->wy2;
00747   }
00748   else {   /* Window has a border */
00749     w->x1 = w->wx1 + 1;
00750     w->y1 = w->wy1 + 1;
00751     w->x2 = w->wx2 - 1;
00752     w->y2 = w->wy2 - 1;
00753   }
00754 
00755   wn_log("wn_open(5) (%d,%d) x2 = %d  y2=%d\n",w->x1,w->y1,w->x2,w->y2);
00756 
00757   /*-----------------------------------
00758     Save variables in window structure
00759   -------------------------------------*/
00760   w->btype     = btype;           /* Border type         */
00761   w->xsize     = xsize;
00762   w->ysize     = ysize;
00763   w->wcolor    = wcolor;
00764   w->bcolor    = bcolor;
00765   w->ccy       = row;            /* Initialize screen cursor row  */
00766   w->ccx       = col;            /* Initialize screen cursor col  */
00767   w->synflg    = FALSE;          /* Standard cursor off           */
00768   w->scroll_ok = TRUE;           /* Standard scrolling window     */
00769   w->scrnsave  = NULL;
00770   w->monitor   = monitor;
00771   w->title     = NULL;
00772   w->page      = 0;
00773 
00774   wn_log("Variables are initialized\n");
00775 
00776   /*---------------------------------------
00777     Save contents of current active window
00778     Add window to double linked list
00779   --------------------------------------*/
00780   if (top_window != NULL) {
00781     wn_save(top_window);
00782   }
00783   add_wn_list(w);
00784   top_window = w;
00785 
00786   /*--------------------------------
00787     Draw window border (if wanted)
00788   --------------------------------*/
00789   if (btype != _NO_BORDER)
00790   {
00791     wn_border(w,btype);
00792   }
00793   /*-----------------------
00794     Add the shadow effect
00795   ------------------------*/
00796   if ( btype != _NO_BORDER && shadow != FALSE)
00797     wn_shadow(w);
00798 
00799   /*------------------------------
00800     Clear the inside of the window
00801   --------------------------------*/
00802   wn_clear(w);
00803 
00804   return(w);
00805 }
00806 
00807 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00808    FUNCTION: wn_close()
00809     PURPOSE: close a window
00810      SYNTAX: WINDOW *wn_close(WINDOW *w);
00811 DESCRIPTION: Checks if window defined,
00812              Deletes it from the linked window list
00813              Free's the memory allocated to it.
00814              Makes the last window in the linked list the top window
00815              Updates the screen.
00816     RETURNS: Alway's returns NULL pointer
00817     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
00818              920919 V0.2 - If the window closed was the top window,
00819                            a NULL pointer will be assigned to 'top_window'
00820 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00821 WINDOW *wn_close(WINDOW *w)
00822 {
00823 
00824   wn_log("wn_close(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
00825 
00826   /*---------------------------
00827     Check if window was opened
00828   -----------------------------*/
00829   if (w) {
00830 
00831     /*-------------------------------------------
00832       Check if window to close is the top window
00833     ---------------------------------------------*/
00834     if (w == top_window) {
00835       top_window = NULL;
00836       last_window = NULL;
00837     }
00838 
00839     /*-----------------------------------------------
00840       Delete the window from the double linked list
00841       and free memory of window's save area and
00842       control block
00843     -------------------------------------------------*/
00844     del_wn_list(w);
00845     if (w->scrnsave)
00846       free(w->scrnsave);
00847     if (w->title)
00848       free(w->title);
00849     free((char *) w);
00850 
00851     /*-----------------------------------------------
00852       Make last window in linked list the top window
00853       and update the screen
00854     -------------------------------------------------*/
00855     wn_top(last_window);
00856     wn_update();
00857   }
00858 
00859   return(NULL);
00860 }
00861 
00862 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00863     FUNCTION: wn_init()
00864      PURPOSE: initialize window and video enviroment
00865       SYNTAX: void wn_init(void);
00866  DESCRIPTION: Sets atexit() pointer.
00867               Initializes global variables _NormAttr, _TextAttr, _LastMode,
00868               _CurCrtSize, _CheckSnow, _DirectVideo, _WindMin and _WindMax.
00869               by calling the assembler function crtinit().
00870               Sets the segmentaddress 'displayseg' of the physical videoscreen.
00871               Gets the current cursor size and position and saves the contents
00872               of the current screen and clears it
00873      RETURNS: nothing
00874      HISTORY: 910710 V0.2 - Adjusted for window enviroment
00875 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00876 void wn_init()
00877 {
00878   /*------------------
00879     Initializations
00880   ------------------*/
00881   wn_log("wn_init()\n");
00882   atexit(wn_exit);
00883 
00884   /*-----------------------------------------------------------------
00885      Initializes global variables _NormAttr, _TextAttr, _LastMode,
00886      _CurCrtSize, _CheckSnow, _DirectVideo, _WindMin and _WindMax.
00887   -----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00888   initscr();
00889 
00890 #if defined(USE_FORTIFY)
00891   Fortify_ListAllMemory();
00892   // Fortify_OutputStatistics();
00893 #endif
00894 
00895   /*-----------------------------
00896     Get original cursor position
00897   --------------------------------*/
00898   v_getcurpos(&startrow,&startcol);
00899   v_cursoroff();
00900 
00901   set_display_colors(COLOR);
00902 
00903   /*---------------------
00904     Open the top window
00905   ----------------------*/
00906   start_screen = v_savescreen(_cursvar.cols,_cursvar.lines);
00907 
00908 #if defined(USE_FORTIFY)
00909   Fortify_ListAllMemory();
00910   // Fortify_OutputStatistics();
00911 #endif
00912 
00913   clrscr();
00914 
00915 }
00916 
00917 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00918     FUNCTION: wn_exit()
00919      PURPOSE: Exit from window enviroment
00920       SYNTAX: void wn_exit(void);
00921  DESCRIPTION: Calls several routines to clean up the HvA window enviroment.
00922               Closes all open windows.
00923               Restores the screen which was there when starting the window
00924               enviroment, restores the cursor position and shows it.
00925               Close the logfile 'window.log' (if opened).
00926      RETURNS: nothing
00927      HISTORY: 910717 V0.1 - Initial version
00928               920107 V0.1 - The functions will be performed only once
00929 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00930 void wn_exit()
00931 {
00932   static int done = FALSE;
00933 
00934   if (!done)               /* Do this only once */
00935   {
00936     wn_log("wn_exit()\n");
00937 
00938     exit_help();
00939     exit_pulldown();
00940     exit_funkey();
00941     wn_closeall();
00942     if (start_screen)
00943       start_screen = v_restorescreen(start_screen);
00944     v_setcurpos(startrow,startcol);
00945     v_cursoron();
00946 
00947     done = TRUE;        /* Set flag (this routine has been executed */
00948   }
00949 }
00950 
00951 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00952     FUNCTION: wnd_overlap()
00953      PURPOSE: Determines if two windows overlap the each other
00954       SYNTAX: int wn_overlap(WINDOW *w1, WINDOW *w2);
00955  DESCRIPTION:
00956      RETURNS: FALSE if no overlap, TRUE if there is an overlap
00957      HISTORY: 21-Oct-1993 V0.1
00958 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00959 int wn_overlap(WINDOW *w1, WINDOW *w2)
00960 {
00961   if (w1->page != w2->page)          /* If not in same page */
00962      return(FALSE);                  /* they can't overlap  */
00963 
00964   if (((w2->x1 >= w1->x1) && (w2->x1 <= w1->x2)) &&
00965      (((w2->y1 >= w1->y1) && (w2->y1 <= w1->y2)) ||
00966       ((w2->y2 >= w1->y1) && (w2->y2 <= w1->y2))))
00967           return(TRUE);
00968 
00969   if (((w2->x2 >= w1->x1) && (w2->x2 <= w1->x2)) &&
00970      (((w2->y1 >= w1->y1) && (w2->y1 <= w1->y2)) ||
00971       ((w2->y2 >= w1->y1) && (w2->y2 <= w1->y2))))
00972           return(TRUE);
00973 
00974   if (((w1->x1 >= w2->x1) && (w1->x2 <= w2->x2)) &&
00975      (((w1->y1 >= w2->y1) && (w1->y1 <= w2->y2)) ||
00976       ((w1->y2 >= w2->y1) && (w1->y2 <= w2->y2))))
00977           return(TRUE);
00978 
00979   if (((w1->y1 >= w2->y1) && (w1->y2 <= w2->y2)) &&
00980      (((w1->x1 >= w2->x1) && (w1->x1 <= w2->x2)) ||
00981       ((w1->x2 >= w2->x1) && (w1->x2 <= w2->x2))))
00982           return(TRUE);
00983 
00984   if ((w1->x1 > w2->x1 && w1->x2 < w2->x2) &&
00985       (w1->y1 > w2->y1 && w1->y2 < w2->y2))
00986           return(TRUE);
00987 
00988   return(FALSE);
00989 }
